payload.summary: Structured guide for writing internet history book with focus on early developme
action_items: Draft a 1-page timeline of 10 pivotal events (e.g., 1993 Mosaic browser launch)
Write a 'Why It Matters' paragraph for each event to build your thesis
Research primary sources: Usenet archives, early Facebook code, *Wired* magazine
Avoid tech jargon; explain concepts through societal impact (e.g., TCP/IP = 'internet's universal language')
Include a section on how pre-social media communities (Usenet) shaped modern platforms
